snippet: While the postseason tournament accounts for roughly 90 percent of the N.C.A.A.’s annual revenue, it has rendered college basketball’s regular season largely irrelevant.
abstract: Analysis; postseason tournament accounts for roughly 90 percent of the NCAA's annual revenue, rendering college basketball's regular season largely irrelevant; league, attempting to infuse more excitement, has turned to tournaments that feature the best teams and gimmick games, but better options may exist.
lead_paragraph: While the postseason tournament accounts for roughly 90 percent of the N.C.A.A.’s annual revenue, it has rendered college basketball’s regular season largely irrelevant.

headline.seo: March Madness Makes Basketball’s Regular Season Seem Irrelevant
headline.main: A Five-Month Season Boils Down to One
headline.print_headline: A Five-Month Season Boils Down to One
